intro: Corchorus schimperi, commonly known as Ethiopian mallow, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fibrous stems are used to make textiles, while the leaves are edible and consumed in local cuisines. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important resource in regions with limited agricultural options.
